title: Faith No More - Introduce Yourself@320
description:
Unlike future FNM albums, this one seems to be bass dominated, as evident on the band&#039;s first minor hit, "We Care A Lot". I&#039;ve always thought that Billy Gould was an amazingly underrated bassist, and his work really shines on this album. The guitars are also some of the best I&#039;ve heard on any Faith No More albums, and some of the choruses are downright catchy.
The many electronics used in the making of this album were also something different. I&#039;ve never really considered Faith No More to be rap-rock or rap-metal, but there are a few moments where Mosley will start rapping (something that I&#039;ve never seen Patton do). That may sound bad when you read it, but it&#039;s pulled off nicely on songs like "Chinese Arithmetic" and "The Crab Song". The overall feel of this album sounds pretty dark, definitely not as dark as "Angel Dust", but more so than "The Real Thing". If you&#039;re a fan of the band, this one&#039;s worth picking up. (from Amazon)


01. Faster Disco
02. Anne&#039;s Song
03. Introduce Yourself
04. Chinese Arithmetic
05. Death March
06. We Care A Lot
